intro: Urostachys attenuatus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and the Himalayas. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features succulent, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and often tinged with red or purple at the base. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Urostachys attenuatus is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
